repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Transcript of an interview of Judge William B. Groat by Professor Maurice F. Neufeld, on March 11, 1966.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Judge William B. Groat (1899-1986) served as counsel to the New York State Joint Legislative Committee on Industrial and Labor Relations, where he played a pivotal role in founding the ILR School and drafting its charter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interview held on Friday, March 11, 1966. Judge William B. Groat, Jutice of the Supreme Court of the State of New York, member of the Judicial Conference of the State of New York, and member of the Advisory Council f the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations, interviewed by Maurice F. Neufeld, of the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations, concerning the origins of the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Judge William B. Groat Interview #/4324 OH. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
